thread.title: Social Media Absolutely Shreds Leicester City Player
thread.title_full: Social Media Absolutely Shreds Leicester City Player

title: Social Media Absolutely Shreds Leicester City Player
text:
Social Media Absolutely Shreds Leicester City Player Wed Feb 22 2017 21:31:27   21:31:27 GMT+0000 (GMT) Nasir Jabbar Nasir Jabbar in football 
Leicester City were salvaging their miserable domestic campaign through their exploits in the Champions League, until tonight as they were beaten by Sevilla though they did score a crucial away goal. 
Following their incredible Premier League triumph last season, the Foxes are experiencing a completely opposite campaign. 
Last year, Claudio Ranieri had his charges firing on all cylinders as they were mounting a serious challenge to the league title. 
But a year on, Ranieri's side are in amidst of a relegation dog-fight, and their European excursions in the balance. 
And their influential skipper Wes Morgan who helped steer Leicester to their unlikely league title is now subject to intense criticism, especially his performance from tonight. 
Morgan conceded a penalty in the first-half as he recklessly brought down the Sevilla man, before Kasper Schmeichel saved his ass by saving the spot-kick. 
Not to mention a series of blunders. Needless to say, Twitter absolutely shred into him. Here are some of the reactions: Wes Morgan has gone from Jaap Stam to pissed up Sunday league Steve overnight. Fck all to do with Ranieri if his players make shit decisions
